content:
Table Class

Definition

A block-level flow content element that provides a grid-based presentation organized by rows and columns.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("RowGroups")]
public class Table : System.Windows.Documents.Block, System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild

Remarks

Table derives from the Block element, and adheres to the common rules for containing a Block element. A Table element may be contained by any of the following elements:

  • FlowDocument
  • TableCell
  • ListBoxItem
  • ListViewItem
  • Section
  • Floater
  • Figure
Note

Table is similar to the Grid element but has more capabilities and, therefore, requires greater resource overhead.

Constructors

Table()

Initializes a new instance of the Table class.

public Table ();

Fields

CellSpacingProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Documents.Table.CellSpacing* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty CellSpacingProperty;

Properties

CellSpacing

Gets or sets the amount of spacing between cells in a table.

public double CellSpacing { get; set; }
Value
Double

The amount of spacing between cells in a table, in device independent pixels.

The default value is 2.0.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="double"/>  
- or -  
<object property="qualifiedDouble"/>

XAML Values

double

Double

String representation of a Double value equal to or greater than 0.0 but smaller than Double. An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels. Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.

qualifiedDouble
A double value as described above, followed by one of the following unit specifiers: px, in, cm, pt.

px (default) is device-independent units (1/96th inch per unit)

in is inches; 1in==96px

cm is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px

pt is points; 1pt==(96/72) px

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field CellSpacingProperty
Metadata properties set to true AffectsMeasure

Columns

Gets a TableColumnCollection object that contains the columns hosted by the table.

public System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection Columns { get; }
Value
TableColumnCollection

A TableColumnCollection object that contains the columns (represented by TableColumn objects) hosted by the table. Note that this number might not be the actual number of columns rendered in the table. It is the TableCell objects in a table that determine how many columns are actually rendered.

This property has no default value.

Remarks

The TableColumn objects returned by this property can, in conjunction with the TableCell objects in the column, be used to define layout of columns but they do not determine the actual number of columns rendered. It is the TableCell objects in a table that determine how many columns are actually rendered. For example, if you define 3 columns but only have table cells for 2 columns, only 2 columns will be rendered.

LogicalChildren

Gets an enumerator that can be used to iterate the logical children of the Table.

protected override System.Collections.IEnumerator LogicalChildren { get; }
Value
IEnumerator

An enumerator for the logical children of the Table.

Remarks

Child objects are enumerated in the following order:

  1. Columns (represented by TableColumn objects).

  2. Row groups (represented by TableRowGroup objects).

RowGroups

Gets a TableRowGroupCollection collection object that contains the row groups hosted by the table.

public System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroupCollection RowGroups { get; }
Value
TableRowGroupCollection

A TableRowGroupCollection collection object that contains the row groups (represented by TableRowGroup objects) hosted by the table.

This property has no default value.

EndInit()

public override void EndInit ();

Creates and returns an AutomationPeer object for this Table.

Returns
AutomationPeer

An AutomationPeer object for this Table.

Remarks

This method overrides OnCreateAutomationPeer.

ShouldSerializeColumns()

Gets a value that indicates whether or not the effective value of the stem.Windows.Documents.Table.Columns* property should be serialized during serialization of a Table object.

public bool ShouldSerializeColumns ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the stem.Windows.Documents.Table.Columns* property should be serialized; otherwise, false.
